title: Ant or other insect
data:
The **ant or other insect** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [a](/wiki/A "A") glyph (a). Ants and insects are designated internally by the macro `S_ANT`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- a [soldier ant](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant")
- a [giant ant](/wiki/Giant_ant "Giant ant")
- a [fire ant](/wiki/Fire_ant "Fire ant")
- a [killer bee](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee")
- a [queen bee](/wiki/Queen_bee "Queen bee")
- a [giant beetle](/wiki/Giant_beetle "Giant beetle")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [3.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [4 References](#References)

## Common traits

Ants and insects are are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that have [limbs](/wiki/Limb "Limb"), but no [hands](/wiki/Hand "Hand"). They are [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") with the exception of both [bees](/wiki/Bee "Bee"), and are also [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") with the exception of the giant beetle.

Centipedes and spiders are arthropods but not insects, and are instead part of the [arachnid or centipede](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede") monster class, s. Fantastic insects such as the [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan") constitute [their own monster class](/wiki/Xan_or_other_mythical/fantastic_insect "Xan or other mythical/fantastic insect").

### Generation

Randomly generated ants and insects monsters are always created hostile.

The clerical [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") will generate ants and insects unless the monster class is [extinct](/wiki/Extinct "Extinct") or [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), in which case [snakes](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)") are generated instead.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The ant or other insect is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"). Ants and other insects may also be generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: one is generated on each of the upper filler level, the lower filler level(s), and the locate level, and two are generated on the goal level.

## Strategy

Most of the insect monsters (particularly the ants) have high [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") along with attacks that are often poisonous or decently strong, making them early-game menaces - the movement speed also makes the weaker attacks like those of the giant ant tough to contend with. Even the much-slower giant beetle, which has a speed of 6, has a bite attack that is the strongest among its monster class.

It is usually not considered worthwhile to genocide any insects with the exception of the soldier ant, which are a significant early-game hazard - while it is possible to take out soldier ants through other means, genociding them can be useful as a form of last resort or emergency option. Otherwise, the insects summoned by hostile priests in [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") and on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") can serve as a valuable barrier between you and most of the tougher monsters (minus the [Riders](/wiki/Riders "Riders")).

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces several new insects:

- a [assassin bug](/wiki/Assassin_bug "Assassin bug")
- a [black wasp](/wiki/Black_wasp "Black wasp")
- a [giant flea](/wiki/Giant_flea "Giant flea")
- a [giant louse](/wiki/Giant_louse "Giant louse")
- a [giant tick](/wiki/Giant_tick "Giant tick")
- a [giant wasp](/wiki/Giant_wasp "Giant wasp")
- a [killer beetle](/wiki/Killer_beetle "Killer beetle")
- a [migo drone](/wiki/Migo_drone "Migo drone")
- a [migo queen](/wiki/Migo_queen "Migo queen")
- a [migo warrior](/wiki/Migo_warrior "Migo warrior")
- a [snow ant](/wiki/Snow_ant "Snow ant")
- a [spitting beetle](/wiki/Spitting_beetle "Spitting beetle")
- a [tsetse fly](/wiki/Tsetse_fly "Tsetse fly")
- a [yellow jacket](/wiki/Yellow_jacket "Yellow jacket")

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") adds one new insect:

- a [locust](/wiki/Locust "Locust")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") adds two new insects:

- a [locust](/wiki/Locust "Locust")
- a [snow ant](/wiki/Snow_ant "Snow ant")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds a few new insects:

- a [giant mosquito](/wiki/Giant_mosquito "Giant mosquito")
- a [giant cockroach](/wiki/Giant_cockroach "Giant cockroach")
- a [locust](/wiki/Locust "Locust")
- a [queen ant](/wiki/Queen_ant "Queen ant")

If the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") monster spell is cast by [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(EvilHack\) "Lolth (EvilHack)") or a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") monster, they will summon [arachnid or centipede](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede") monsters instead of insects.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 15](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L15)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 106](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L106)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 589](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mcastu.c#L589)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ant or other insect

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The ant or other insect is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase a glyph (a). Ants and insects are designated internally by the macro S_ANT.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • a soldier ant
  • a giant ant
  • a fire ant
  • a killer bee
  • a queen bee
  • a giant beetle

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 SporkHack
    • 3.3 UnNetHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack
  • 4 References

Common traits

Ants and insects are are neutral-aligned animals that have limbs, but no hands. They are carnivorous with the exception of both bees, and are also oviparous with the exception of the giant beetle.

Centipedes and spiders are arthropods but not insects, and are instead part of the arachnid or centipede monster class, s. Fantastic insects such as the xan constitute their own monster class.

Generation

Randomly generated ants and insects monsters are always created hostile.

The clerical monster spell summon insects will generate ants and insects unless the monster class is extinct or genocided, in which case snakes are generated instead.[3]

The ant or other insect is the first quest monster class for Valkyries, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Valkyrie quest. Ants and other insects may also be generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: one is generated on each of the upper filler level, the lower filler level(s), and the locate level, and two are generated on the goal level.

Strategy

Most of the insect monsters (particularly the ants) have high speed along with attacks that are often poisonous or decently strong, making them early-game menaces - the movement speed also makes the weaker attacks like those of the giant ant tough to contend with. Even the much-slower giant beetle, which has a speed of 6, has a bite attack that is the strongest among its monster class.

It is usually not considered worthwhile to genocide any insects with the exception of the soldier ant, which are a significant early-game hazard - while it is possible to take out soldier ants through other means, genociding them can be useful as a form of last resort or emergency option. Otherwise, the insects summoned by hostile priests in Moloch's Sanctum and on the Astral Plane can serve as a valuable barrier between you and most of the tougher monsters (minus the Riders).

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces several new insects:

  • a assassin bug
  • a black wasp
  • a giant flea
  • a giant louse
  • a giant tick
  • a giant wasp
  • a killer beetle
  • a migo drone
  • a migo queen
  • a migo warrior
  • a snow ant
  • a spitting beetle
  • a tsetse fly
  • a yellow jacket

SporkHack

SporkHack adds one new insect:

  • a locust

UnNetHack

UnNetHack adds two new insects:

  • a locust
  • a snow ant

EvilHack

EvilHack adds a few new insects:

  • a giant mosquito
  • a giant cockroach
  • a locust
  • a queen ant

If the summon insects monster spell is cast by Lolth or a drow monster, they will summon arachnid or centipede monsters instead of insects.

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 15
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 106
  3. ↑ src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 589

Ants and other insects may also be generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: one is generated on each of the upper filler level, the lower filler level(s), and the locate level, and two are generated on the goal level. ==Strategy== Most of the insect monsters (particularly the ants) have high [[speed]] along with attacks that are often poisonous or decently strong, making them early-game menaces - the movement speed also makes the weaker attacks like those of the giant ant tough to contend with. Even the much-slower giant beetle, which has a speed of 6, has a bite attack that is the strongest among its monster class. It is usually not considered worthwhile to genocide any insects with the exception of the soldier ant, which are a significant early-game hazard - while it is possible to take out soldier ants through other means, genociding them can be useful as a form of last resort or emergency option. Otherwise, the insects summoned by hostile priests in [[Moloch's Sanctum]] and on the [[Astral Plane]] can serve as a valuable barrier between you and most of the tougher monsters (minus the [[Riders]]). ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] introduces several new insects: * {{darkgray|a}} [[assassin bug]] * {{yellow|a}} [[black wasp]] * {{gray|a}} [[giant flea]] * {{gray|a}} [[giant louse]] * {{gray|a}} [[giant tick]] * {{darkgray|a}} [[giant wasp]] * {{orange|a}} [[killer beetle]] * {{green|a}} [[migo drone]] * {{magenta|a}} [[migo queen]] * {{yellow|a}} [[migo warrior]] * {{monsymlink|snow ant}} * {{brown|a}} [[spitting beetle]] * {{green|a}} [[tsetse fly]] * {{yellow|a}} [[yellow jacket]] ===SporkHack=== [[SporkHack]] adds one new insect: * {{monsymlink|locust}} ===UnNetHack=== [[UnNetHack]] adds two new insects: * {{monsymlink|locust}} * {{monsymlink|snow ant}} ===EvilHack=== [[EvilHack]] adds a few new insects: * {{orange|a}} [[giant mosquito]] * {{green|a}} [[giant cockroach]] * {{monsymlink|locust}} * {{cyan|a}} [[queen ant]] If the [[summon insects]] monster spell is cast by [[Lolth (EvilHack)|Lolth]] or a [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] monster, they will summon [[arachnid or centipede]] monsters instead of insects. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Monster classes]]
